alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:28PM CST until January 25 at 9:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Long King Creek near Livingston affecting San Jacinto and Polk Counties. Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Polk and Hardin Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. Spring Creek Near Hegar Road affecting Harris County. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Colorado and Wharton Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Spring Creek near Hegar Road. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:05 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 214.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 0.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:05 PM CST Wednesday was 214.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 206.4 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 214.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 214.3 feet on 01/18/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Spring Creek Hegar Road 214.0 214.6 Wed 9 pm CST MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 930 AM CST.
